author: Special Correspondent
text:
Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala's son Bhavdeep Vala has written to Rajkot police commissioner seeking to register a case against Sameer Shah, a leading industrialist of Rajkot and owner of Rajmoti oil mill, for cheating.

Mr. Bhavdeep has demanded a case of cheating against Shah and others claiming that he is also a sleeping partner in Rajmoti oil mill, a local edible oil manufacturing unit in Saurashtra.

Interestingly, president of Saurashtra Oil Millers' Association and Rajkot Chambers of Commerce and Industries, Mr. Shah is wanted by the police in a recent murder case of an employee of his mill.

“I was a sleeping partner in Rajmoti Oil Mill from year 2006 to 2014. However, I ended the partnership in March 2014,” Mr. Bhavdeep Vala stated in his letter to the police commissioner Anupam Singh Gehlot.
title: Karnataka Governor’s son to file case against Gujarat industrialist
